title: Penguins EDA
text:
Load packages


Code
library(dplyr)



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union


Code
library(dbplyr)



Attaching package: 'dbplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:dplyr':

    ident, sql


Code
library(ggplot2)


Database connection


Code
con <- DBI::dbConnect(
  duckdb::duckdb(), 
  dbdir = "my-db.duckdb"
)


Connect to data


Code
df <- dplyr::tbl(con, "penguins")


Aggregate data


Code
df |>
  summarise(
    .by = c(species, sex),
    across(
      ends_with("mm") | ends_with("g"), 
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
    )
  ) |>
  dplyr::collect() |>
  knitr::kable()

title: Penguins EDA
section: Penguin Size vs Mass by Species
text:
Penguin Size vs Mass by Species


Code
df |>
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_smooth()`).


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).









Database disconnect


Code
DBI::dbDisconnect(con, shutdown=TRUE)

title: Model
text:
Code
from pandas import get_dummies
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn import preprocessing
from vetiver import VetiverModel, vetiver_pin_write
import pins
import duckdb

title: Model
text:
Get Data
Database connect


Code
con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb')


Read data


Code
df = con.execute("SELECT * FROM penguins").fetch_df().dropna()

df.head(3)










species
island
bill_length_mm
bill_depth_mm
flipper_length_mm

Database disconnect


Code
con.close()

title: Model
text:
Define Model and Fit


Code
X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True)
y = df['body_mass_g']

model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

title: Model
text:
Get some information


Code
print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}")
print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}")
print(f"Columns {X.columns}")
print(f"Coefficients {model.coef_}")


R^2 0.8555368759537614
Intercept 2169.2697209393996
Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_male'], dtype='object')
Coefficients [  32.53688677 -298.76553447 1094.86739145  547.36692408]

title: Model
text:
Store model


Code
v = VetiverModel(model, model_name='penguin_model', prototype_data=X)
b = pins.board_folder('data/model', allow_pickle_read=True)
vetiver_pin_write(b, v)


Model Cards provide a framework for transparent, responsible reporting. 
 Use the vetiver `.qmd` Quarto template as a place to start, 
 with vetiver.model_card()
